- add tests confirming baseline placement and descender rendering for lowercase text

title: Added missing is_covered_with_solder_mask in circle plated hole
description: Adds an optional is_covered_with_solder_mask field to PcbPlatedHoleCircle, allowing explicit control of solder-mask coverage for plated holes.
body:
This PR adds an optional is_covered_with_solder_mask field to PcbPlatedHoleCircle, updating both the Zod schema and TypeScript interface. This allows consumers to explicitly control solder-mask coverage for plated holes.


This will fix the CI fail on this PR : https://github.com/tscircuit/circuit-to-svg/pull/441

title: Add Polygon SMT Pad Support to Bounds & Transform Utilities
description: Adds support for polygon-shaped SMT pads in both bounds and transform utilities, fixing PCB Auto Packing not working on polygon pads in core.
body: Adds support for polygon-shaped SMT pads in both bounds and transform utilities. Bounds now compute min/max from the pads points array. Transform now applies the matrix to each polygon point. This fixes PCB Auto Packing not working on polygon pads in core this is a snapshot from core repro68 after yalcing this fix

title: Introduce `<fiducial />`, `<subpanel />`, new panel layout modes, `boardGap`
description: Adds new components fiducial  and subpanel , introduces new layout modes for panels, and adds a boardGap property to the panel component.

title: Add C75740 raw easy asset, schema and snapshot
description: Add a new electronic component footprint for the C75740 D-SUB 9-pin connector, including its schema and snapshot for use in circuit designs.

title: Support soldermask for boards and allow to hide top/bottom soldermask
description: Adds support for soldermask layers on PCB boards, allowing users to toggle visibility for top and bottom soldermask layers.
body: Fixes TSC-121

title: Add Transparency to translucent models
description: Adds support for translucent models by introducing a transparency feature in the rendering of various model types.

title: Improve mainfold via
description: Refactors the via geometry generation logic to improve the accuracy and visual representation of PCB vias, fixes a bug in drill hole processing, and adds new Storybook stories for testing and demonstration.
body: This pull request refactors the via geometry generation logic to improve the accuracy and visual representation of PCB vias, and adds new Storybook stories for testing and demonstration. The main changes include a more precise modeling of via copper geometry, a bug fix in how via drill holes are processed, and the introduction of component stories for visual validation. Ref https://linear.app/tscircuit/issue/TSC-177/vias-in-3d-viewer-should-have-dumbell-shape-not-cylinder-shape ### 3D Render ### Via geometry modeling improvements * Refactored the `createViaCopper` function in `src/utils/via-geoms.ts` to separately model the barrel and annular rings, ensuring the barrel does not exceed pad size and improving the realism of the via geometry. The drill hole is now sized to clear both pads. ### Bug fixes in via processing * Fixed a bug in `processViasForManifold` in `src/utils/manifold/process-vias.ts` by using `hole_diameter` instead of `outer_diameter` for the drill hole, ensuring correct drill sizing for each via. ### Storybook and testing enhancements * Added new stories in `stories/Via.stories.tsx` to visualize vias both with and without a PCB board, enabling easier testing and demonstration of via rendering in the `CadViewer` component.

title: Refactor: remove inflateSourceBoard and introduce inflatePcbBoard for cleaner PCB handling
description: Refactors board inflation logic to rely on pcb_board entries only, replacing inflateSourceBoard with the new inflatePcbBoard and updating inflateCircuitJson accordingly.
body:
Refactors board inflation logic to rely on pcb_board entries only.
Replaces inflateSourceBoard with the new inflatePcbBoard and updates inflateCircuitJson accordingly.

title: Update circuit-json-util to fix polygon pad PCB packing
description: Fixes polygon pad packing issues during PCB layout by upgrading tscircuitcircuit-json-util to version 0.0.73, ensuring correct bounds and geometry handling.
body:
Upgrades `@tscircuit/circuit-json-util` to the latest version, which includes fixes for polygon-shaped SMT pad packing.
Ensures correct bounds/geometry handling so polygon pads pack properly during PCB layout.

title: Propagate async effect detection to children
description: Check renderable children for incomplete async effects so traversal is shared across component types and remove the redundant Group override now that the base class handles children.
body:
## Summary
- check renderable children for incomplete async effects so traversal is shared across component types
- remove the redundant Group override now that the base class handles children

## Testing
- bun test tests/footprint/footprint-kicad-url-in-group.test.tsx
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun run format


------

title: Add inflateSourceBoard to support board inflation from circuit-json
description: Adds a new inflateSourceBoard inflator that creates a Board component from source_board entries in circuit-json. Prevents double-inflation when a board is already present. Wires board inflation into inflateCircuitJson to ensure boards render correctly in subcircuits.
body:
Adds a new inflateSourceBoard inflator that creates a Board component from source_board entries in circuit-json.
Prevents double-inflation when a <board> is already present.
Wires board inflation into inflateCircuitJson to ensure boards render correctly in subcircuits.

title: Add panel anchor-offset indicators and bump tscircuit & circuit-json  versions
description: Adds anchor-offset indicator rendering for PCB panels and fixes the Y-offset sign issue in createAnchorOffsetIndicators while updating tscircuit-related dependencies to their latest versions.
body:
Added anchor-offset indicator rendering for PCB panels and fixes the Y-offset sign issue in `createAnchorOffsetIndicators`. It also updates multiple `tscircuit-related` dependencies to their latest versions to keep the project aligned with recent features and tests.
Includes updated snapshots for panel rendering.

title: add the via route_type only once in the pcb_trace segment

title: Watch node_modules/*/dist/index.js by modifying should-ignore-path to not ignore the path
description: Enables the DevServer to watch node_modulesdistindex.js files for changes, including scoped packages, by modifying the should-ignore-path configuration.
body:
Fixes TSC-180


This fix enables the DevServer to watch `node_modules/*/dist/index.js` files for changes (including scoped packages like @scope/pkg/dist/index.js). Since chokidar checks each directory level when traversing, we use brace expansion to allow all parent directories in the pathotherwise chokidar stops at `node_modules` and never reaches the target files. The pattern `!node_modules{,/*,/*/dist,/*/dist/index.js,/@*,/@*/*,/@*/*/dist,/@*/*/dist/index.js}` compactly negates all required paths so chokidar can descend into `node_modules` and watch only the specific `dist/index.js` files while still ignoring everything else.

title: Handle `tsci search` shows undefined versions
description: Fixes the issue where the tsci search command displays vundefined for packages with missing version information.
body:
Ref: https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/1505

Input:
`tsci search resistor`
### Before (bug - when API returns packages with undefined version):
```
Found 3 package(s) in the tscircuit registry:
1. tscircuit/smd-resistor (vundefined) - Stars: 12 - SMD resistor component
2. user/power-resistor (v1.2.0) - Stars: 5 - Power resistor
3. another/resistor-pack (vundefined) - Stars: 0
```

### After (fix - handles missing versions):
```
Found 3 package(s) in the tscircuit registry:
1. tscircuit/smd-resistor - Stars: 12 - SMD resistor component
2. user/power-resistor (v1.2.0) - Stars: 5 - Power resistor
3. another/resistor-pack - Stars: 0
```

title: Remove unused comment

title: Add a new doc for installing kicad-libraries
description: Adds documentation for installing KiCad libraries from GitHub using the tscircuit command.

title: Multi Layer Connection Points, setup for unravel solver supporting switching initial layer of paths
description: Add MultiLayerConnectionPoint and refactor to support MultiLayerConnectionPoint in routing solvers and utilities
body:
- **Add MultiLayerConnectionPoint**
- **refactor: support MultiLayerConnectionPoint in routing solvers and utilities**

title: Fix Downloading High Density Nodes
description: Fixes the issue where high density nodes were not being downloaded correctly due to incorrect label matching in the autorouting debugger.

title: add bug report 18
description: Adds a comprehensive bug report and test for autorouting issues related to specific circuit configurations.

title: Improve route stitching algorithm and add Z-lock constraints for target nodes
description: Refactors the route stitching logic and fixes layer assignment issues in the unravel solver by removing the RouteDirectionFixSubSolver, improving route stitching selection with a scoring system, adding Z-lock constraints for target nodes, and handling edge cases in the SingleSimplifiedPathSolver.
body:
This PR refactors the route stitching logic and fixes layer assignment issues in the unravel solver.
Key changes:

- Removed RouteDirectionFixSubSolver: The route direction optimization is now handled within SingleHighDensityRouteStitchSolver, simplifying the pipeline.
- Improved route stitching selection: Replaced the "disjoint route" heuristic with a scoring system that prioritizes same-layer connections, then via transitions, then gap bridging. This handles small gaps and multi-layer routes more robustly.
- Added Z-lock for target nodes: Segment points inside nodes containing targets can no longer have their Z (layer) changed during unraveling. This prevents the solver from moving traces off-layer at connection points, fixing routing failures.
- Edge case fix: Handle when layer change occurs at the last point in SingleSimplifiedPathSolver5_Deg45.

title: Add circuit schematic SVG for SparkFun Photo Interrupter Breakout Board GP1A57HRJ00F
description: Adds a new board definition for the SparkFun Photo Interrupter Breakout Board (GP1A57HRJ00F), including a custom component definition and a new board layout with supporting components.
body: This pull request adds a new board definition for the SparkFun Photo Interrupter Breakout Board (GP1A57HRJ00F), including both the main component and the overall board circuit. The changes introduce a custom component definition for the GP1A57HRJ00F device and a new board layout that incorporates this device along with supporting components. **New component and board definition:** * Component definition: - Added a new React component `GP1A57HRJ00F` in `GP1A57HRJ00F.tsx`, including detailed pin labeling, footprint (with plated holes and silkscreen), supplier/manufacturer info, and a CAD model reference. * Board layout: - Created a new board schematic in `SparkFun-Photo-Interrupter-Breakout-Board-GP1A57HRJ00F.circuit.tsx` that instantiates the `GP1A57HRJ00F` component, a resistor, and a jumper with appropriate connections and placements.

title: Remove unnecessary position adjustment for OBJ model meshes in convertCircuitJsonTo3D function
description: Removes the logic that adjusted the vertical position of loaded OBJ meshes in the convertCircuitJsonTo3D function, simplifying the mesh positioning behavior.
body: This pull request makes a small adjustment to the `convertCircuitJsonTo3D` function in `lib/converters/circuit-to-3d.ts`. The change removes the logic that adjusted the vertical position of loaded OBJ meshes to align their bottom with the specified position, simplifying the mesh positioning behavior.

title: test: add copper pour soldermask differentiation test
description: Implements copper pour soldermask differentiation in GLTF rendering by integrating the two-layer soldermask approach from circuit-to-svg, ensuring copper pours render correctly based on their covered_with_solder_mask flag.
body: Implements copper pour soldermask differentiation in GLTF rendering by integrating the two-layer soldermask approach from circuit-to-svg. This ensures copper pours render correctly based on their `covered_with_solder_mask` flag. - **Updated circuit-to-svg**: Upgraded from `v0.0.240` to `v0.0.283` to include soldermask PR #438 - **Enabled soldermask rendering**: Added `showSolderMask: true` flag in `board-renderer.ts` to activate two-layer soldermask approach - **Removed custom overrides**: Removed soldermask color overrides to use default colors from circuit-to-svg ## Testing All tests pass with updated snapshots: Ref 2d snapshot:

description: Adds a test case to reproduce the Z-coordinate position offset issue in the CAD model for component C75749.

title: feat: Add all the missing classes for the SpectraSession file
description: This pull request introduces several new classes and modifications to existing classes in the SpectraSession file, enhancing the functionality and structure of the codebase. Key changes include the addition of classes such as SesBaseDesign, SesLibraryOut, SesNet, and others, which are essential for handling SES files. The modifications also include updates to existing classes to accommodate new functionalities, such as allowing the layer property to accept both string and number types. Overall, this PR aims to improve the handling of SES files and their associated data structures.

title: fix: the net name output format in the same line
description: Fixes the net name output format to ensure the net name appears on the same line as the opening parenthesis in the output string.

title: feat: Add outline fixture page and data
description: Adds a new page to showcase the 2D outline visualization using SimpleRouteJson data for testing and demonstration.
body: Adds 'pages/outline.page.tsx' to showcase the new 2D outline visualization. This page utilizes 'test-assets/outline.json', which provides SimpleRouteJson data including a custom outline, enabling direct testing and demonstration of the feature.

title: feat: visualize board outline in 2D debugger
description: Updates the visualize() method to draw the board outline as a closed loop of lines if srj.outline is present, falling back to the rectangular bounding box otherwise, providing a more accurate 2D representation for non-rectangular boards.
body: Updates the visualize() method to draw the board outline as a closed loop of lines if 'srj.outline' is present, falling back to the rectangular bounding box otherwise. This provides a more accurate 2D representation for non-rectangular boards.

title: Introduce full multi-layer copper architecture with dedicated top/bottom processing and via-aware trace splitting
description: Summary This PR introduces a full multi-layer copper architecture featuring independent top and bottom copper processing, precise via-aware trace splitting, and flexible layer-selective export. These improvements elevate the converter to true multi-layer PCB capability and enable advanced manufacturing workflows such as selective laser cutting, single-side operations, and accurate double-sided production. Key Enhancements 1. Dedicated TopBottom Copper Layers Replaces the previous single copper pipeline Each layer receives its own geometry and cut settings Supports double-sided PCB workflows with proper layer isolation 2. Via-Aware Multi-Layer Trace Splitting Correctly segments traces at vias Distributes trace geometry to the appropriate copper layer Ensures accurate copper distribution across stackups 3. New includeLayers Option (with full examples) The converter now allows exporting any combination of copper layers: tsx  Process all layers (default) convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson)  Process only top layer convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson,  includeLayers: top )  Process only bottom layer convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson,  includeLayers: bottom )  Process both layers explicitly (bottom, top is equivalent to default) convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson,  includeLayers: bottom, top )  Supports single-sided manufacturing Allows explicit multi-layer selection Maintains full backward compatibility 4. Updated Element Handling SMT Pads: Routed based on layer property Traces: Grouped and processed by copper layer Vias  Plated Holes: Added to both copper layers  through-board layer Reflects real-world multi-layer PCB behavior Cut Settings Update Previous: Copper Through Board Soldermask New: Top Copper (index 0) Bottom Copper (index 1) Through Board (index 2) Soldermask (index 3) This provides granular control but introduces index changes. Motivation The previous single-layer approach prevented accurate multi-layer export, limiting: Side-specific laser settings Selective production of top or bottom side Correct representation of traces that change layers via vias This PR removes these limitations and establishes a robust, production-ready multi-layer pipeline. Testing  Validation  All 39 existing tests pass  Comprehensive multi-layer tests added (using keyboard-default60.json)  Verified trace splitting at vias  Verified per-layer filtering and geometry isolation Tested on a 183-trace multi-layer board: All layers  Top: 402, Bottom: 512, Through: 455 Top only  402  through-board Bottom only  512  through-board Both explicitly  Same as all layers Breaking Changes  Cut setting indices updated: Soldermask: 2  3 Through Board: 1  2 Projects that reference indices numerically may require updates. Conclusion This PR delivers a complete, robust multi-layer copper system, enabling precise topbottom separation, accurate via segmentation, and flexible layer inclusion for manufacturing workflows. It significantly improves correctness, configurability, and production readiness.
body:
### Summary

This PR introduces a full multi-layer copper architecture featuring independent top and bottom copper processing, precise via-aware trace splitting, and flexible layer-selective export. These improvements elevate the converter to true multi-layer PCB capability and enable advanced manufacturing workflows such as selective laser cutting, single-side operations, and accurate double-sided production.

Key Enhancements

1. Dedicated Top/Bottom Copper Layers
		Replaces the previous single copper pipeline
		Each layer receives its own geometry and cut settings
		Supports double-sided PCB workflows with proper layer isolation

2. Via-Aware Multi-Layer Trace Splitting
		Correctly segments traces at vias
		Distributes trace geometry to the appropriate copper layer
		Ensures accurate copper distribution across stackups

3. New includeLayers Option (with full examples)

The converter now allows exporting any combination of copper layers:
```tsx
// Process all layers (default)
convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson)

// Process only top layer
convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson, { includeLayers: ["top"] })

// Process only bottom layer
convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson, { includeLayers: ["bottom"] })

// Process both layers explicitly (["bottom", "top"] is equivalent to default)
convertCircuitJsonToLbrn(circuitJson, { includeLayers: ["bottom", "top"] })
```

		Supports single-sided manufacturing
		Allows explicit multi-layer selection
		Maintains full backward compatibility

4. Updated Element Handling
		SMT Pads: Routed based on layer property
		Traces: Grouped and processed by copper layer
		Vias / Plated Holes: Added to both copper layers + through-board layer
		Reflects real-world multi-layer PCB behavior

Cut Settings Update

Previous:
		Copper
		Through Board
		Soldermask

New:
		Top Copper (index 0)
		Bottom Copper (index 1)
		Through Board (index 2)
		Soldermask (index 3)

This provides granular control but introduces index changes.

Motivation

The previous single-layer approach prevented accurate multi-layer export, limiting:
		Side-specific laser settings
		Selective production of top or bottom side
		Correct representation of traces that change layers via vias

This PR removes these limitations and establishes a robust, production-ready multi-layer pipeline.

Testing & Validation
		 All 39 existing tests pass
		 Comprehensive multi-layer tests added (using keyboard-default60.json)
		 Verified trace splitting at vias
		 Verified per-layer filtering and geometry isolation
		Tested on a 183-trace multi-layer board:
		All layers  Top: 402, Bottom: 512, Through: 455
		Top only  402 + through-board
		Bottom only  512 + through-board
		Both explicitly  Same as all layers

Breaking Changes

 Cut setting indices updated:
		Soldermask: 2  3
		Through Board: 1  2
Projects that reference indices numerically may require updates.

Conclusion

This PR delivers a complete, robust multi-layer copper system, enabling precise top/bottom separation, accurate via segmentation, and flexible layer inclusion for manufacturing workflows. It significantly improves correctness, configurability, and production readiness.

title: Add SVG snapshot coverage for circuit elements
description: Add SVG snapshot coverage for circuit elements by implementing a helper to render circuit geometry layers into SVG for snapshot testing and adding tests for board outlines, pads, traces, cutouts, and plated holes.
body:
## Summary
- add a helper to render circuit geometry layers into SVG for snapshot testing
- add SVG snapshot tests for board outlines, pads, traces, cutouts, and plated holes (one per file)

## Testing
- BUN_UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 bun test tests/svg-*.test.ts
- BUN_UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 bun test tests/svg-smt-pad.test.ts
- bunx tsc --noEmit
